channel.description:
Introduction: Hardware Virtualization - Part #4294967295

Hey ho fellow 0x00ers, Over the last weeks I have researched and wrote some articles about hardware virtualization. Nearly half of the planned articles are done. I will finish the other ones when I have some more time. Anyway, the important thing I have to mention is, that these articles only focus on Intel’s _hardware_ virtualization technologies and x86_64 processors! On top of that, I only cover a fraction of the existing ways to virtualize software. Nonetheless, I hope you get a deeper understanding how your VMs are kept running and how they protect you. So put your mining hat on, it is going deep down --> Part #0 - [Basics and life cycle of a VM](https://0x00sec.org/t/basics-and-lifecycle-of-a-vm-part-0/8723) Part #1 - [The VMCS](https://0x00sec.org/t/the-vmcs-part-1/8739) Part #2 - [A lot about Paging, a little about virtualization](https://0x00sec.org/t/a-lot-about-paging-a-little-about-virtualization-part-2/8868/2) Part #3 - VT-d Part #4 - Three cheers for Qubes Part #5 - Write up of a Qubes/Xen exploit Part #X - Don't know yet, depends on my motivation, maybe something about Para-Virtualization. [details="Edit"] - Added links and and headline. [/details]
